title-group.article-title: History Lessons: Race and the LDS Church

bio.p: MAX PERRY MUELLER {maxabelg@gmail.com} teaches religion at Mount Holyoke College. He recently completed his PhD in American religious history at Harvard University.He and Gina Colvin are coediting a special edition of theJournal of Mormon Historyon race and Mormonism for the summer 2015 issue.

ref.mixed-citation:
Emily Jensen ,“Groundbreaking Scriptural Heading Changes: Official Declaration 2,”
By Common Consent ,February 28,2012,http://bycommonconsent.com/2013/02/28/groundbreaking-scriptural-headingchanges-official-declaration-2(accessed May 22, 2014); Joanna Brooks ,“Significant Changes to LDS Scripture Reflect Shifting Church Views on Racist History,”
Religion Dispatches ,March 2,2013,http://www.religiondispatches.org/dispatches/Joannabrooks/6889/(accessed May 22, 2014).

Peggy Fletcher Stack ,“New Mormon Scriptures Tweak Race, Polygamy References,”
Salt Lake Tribune ,March 1,2013,http://www.sltrib.com/sltrib/news/55930173-78/church-lds-changes-mormon.html.csp(accessed May 22, 2014).

In this essay, I limit the discussion of “race” to what critical race theorists call the “Black/White Binary,” which has dominated the history and historiography of American race relations. Juan F. Perea ,“The Black/ White Binary Paradigm of Race,”in Critical Race Theory: The Cutting Edge , edited by Richard Delgado (:Temple University Press,2000),344–53. The forthcoming special issue on race and Mormonism for the Journal of Mormon History , which I am co-editing with Gina Colvin, aims to move this scholarship beyond the black-white binary and beyond its emphasis on the U.S. experience.

Joseph W. Sitati ,“Blessings of the Gospel Available to All,” LDS General Conference,October 2009,http://www.lds.org/general-conference/2009/10/blessings-of-the-gospel-available-to-all?lang=eng&query=SouthAfrica(accessed April 10, 2014).

InThe Way to Perfection, an extended treatise on Mormon practical divinity, Joseph Fielding Smith expands upon the Pearl of Great Price exegetical justifications for the priesthood ban, first articulated by Church leaders like his father, Joseph F. Smith, and B. H. Roberts. Yet Joseph Fielding Smith adds the “pre-existence thesis” to the scriptural rationalization for denying blacks the priesthood and full Church membership. Joseph Fielding Smith , The Way to Perfection (:Zion's Printing and Publishing for Utah Genealogical Society,1940),43–44,97–111. See also Newell G. Bring hurst , Saints, Slaves and Blacks: The Changing Place of Black People within Mormonism (:Greenwood Press,1981),171; Armand L. Mauss , All Abraham's Children: Changing Mormon Conceptions of Race and Lineage (:University of Illinois Press,2003),29–31.

LDS Church First Presidency Statement on the Question of Blacks within the Church, August 17, 1949, reprinted in Bringhurst , Saints, Slaves, and Blacks ,230–31; Lester E. Bush ,“Mormonism's Negro Doctrine:An Historical Overview,”
Dialogue: A Journal of Mormon Thought
8(Spring 1973):11–68; Henry Wolfinger ,“A Test of Faith: Jane Manning Elizabeth James and the Origins of the Utah Black Community,”in Social Accommodation in Utah , edited by Clark Knowlton (:American West Center, University of Utah,1975),126–72.
Paul Ricoeur , Memory, History, Forgetting (:University of Chicago Press,2006),448–56.
“Minutes:August 26, 1908” and “Minutes: Council Meeting, June 4, 1879”; Bush ,“Mormonism's Negro Doctrine,” 79–81.

Here we can, I believe, apply Ernst Renan's famous quip about the creation of national identity to the creation and maintenance of the LDS hierarchy's prophetic identity. “The essence of a nation is that all individuals have many things in common, and also that they have forgotten many things.” Ernest Renan ,“What Is a Nation?”(1882) in Nation and Narration , edited by Homi Bhabha (:Routledge,1990),11.
Mauss , All Abraham's Children ,240. See also Bush ,“Mormonism's Negro Doctrine,” 80–82.
Mauss , All Abraham's Children ,231–67.

In 1997, Edward L. Kimball, son of the late President Spencer W. Kimball, wrote a letter to Lester Bush, informing him that his article, “The Negro Doctrine,” first published inDialoguein 1973, “was a very important event in setting the stage for [the revelation].”Edward L. Kimball to Lester Bush, March 26, 1997, Box 3, fd. 8, Special Collections, Marriott Library, University of Utah; Lester E. Bush ,“Writing ‘Mormonism's Negro Doctrine: An Historical Overview’ (1973): Context and Reflections,”
Journal of Mormon History
25, no.1(1999):229–71; Ricoeur , Memory, History, Forgetting ,167–68.

Pioneer (periodical of the Sons of Utah Pioneers)May/June 1994,16–19.

On February 5, 1852, when Utah's first territorial legislature session had made slavery legal in the territory, Brigham Young declared ,“If there never was a prophet, or apostle of Jesus Christ spoke it before, I tell you, this people that are commonly called negroes are the children of old Cain. I know they are, I know that they cannot bear rule in the priesthood.”
Fred C. Collier , ed., The Teachings of Brigham Young (:Collier's Publishing,1987),43. While conducting his groundbreaking research in the archives of what was then called the Church Historian's Office, Lester Bush was interviewed by Joseph Fielding Smith. According to Bush, the longtime Church Historian told him that Bush's research was pointless, as “the work on blacks and the priesthood already had been done (i.e., his own work), and that the Church didn't want every ‘Tom, Dick, or Harry’ looking through its records.” Bush ,“Writing ‘Mormonism's Negro Doctrine’ (1973),” 235.
“Race and the Priesthood,”essay,www.lds.org/topics/race-andthe-priesthood?lang=eng.

It should be recognized that this type of instruction already happens informally. See Margaret Blair Young's series of posts describing her mentoring relationships with Mormon missionaries sent to Africa.“The Real Elder Price and the Mormon Boys: An Introduction,”
Patheos ,December 2,2011,http://www.patheos.com/Resources/Additional-Resources/Real-Elder-Price-and-the-Mormon-Boys-Margaret-Blair-Young-12-02-2011.html(accessed August 14, 2014).
